TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit AdjustableArrowCap extends System.Drawing.Drawing2D.CustomLineCap

Docs.summary: Represents an adjustable arrow-shaped line cap. This class cannot be inherited.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(float32 width, float32 height) cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified width and height. The arrow end caps created with this constructor are always filled.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following example is designed for use with Windows Forms, and it requires <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs>`e`, an <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.OnPaint%2A> event object. The code performs the following actions:
- Creates an <xref:System.Drawing.Drawing2D.AdjustableArrowCap> object named `myArrow`.
- Creates a <xref:System.Drawing.Pen> object named `capPen`, and sets its <xref:System.Drawing.Pen.CustomStartCap%2A> and <xref:System.Drawing.Pen.CustomEndCap%2A> properties equal to `myArrow`.
- Uses the <xref:System.Drawing.Graphics.DrawLine%2A> method to draw to screen a line capped by two arrows.
[!code-cpp[System.Drawing.Drawing2D.ClassicMisc#1](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Drawing.Drawing2D.ClassicMisc/CPP/form1.cpp#1)] [!code-csharp[System.Drawing.Drawing2D.ClassicMisc#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Drawing.Drawing2D.ClassicMisc/CS/form1.cs#1)] [!code-vb[System.Drawing.Drawing2D.ClassicMisc#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Drawing.Drawing2D.ClassicMisc/VB/form1.vb#1)]

MemberSignature.Value: public AdjustableArrowCap (float width, float height, bool isFilled);
.method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(float32 width, float32 height, bool isFilled) cil managed

Docs.param: to fill the arrow cap; otherwise, .
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with the specified width, height, and fill property. Whether an arrow end cap is filled depends on the argument passed to the parameter.

remarks.format:
## Examples The following example is designed for use with Windows Forms, and it requires <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs>`e`, an <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.OnPaint%2A> event object. The code performs the following actions:
- Creates an <xref:System.Drawing.Drawing2D.AdjustableArrowCap> object named `myArrow`.
- Creates a <xref:System.Drawing.Pen> object named `capPen`, and sets its <xref:System.Drawing.Pen.CustomStartCap%2A> and <xref:System.Drawing.Pen.CustomEndCap%2A> properties equal to `myArrow`.
- Uses the <xref:System.Drawing.Graphics.DrawLine%2A> method to draw to screen a line capped by two arrows.
[!code-cpp[System.Drawing.Drawing2D.ClassicMisc#2](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Drawing.Drawing2D.ClassicMisc/CPP/form1.cpp#2)] [!code-csharp[System.Drawing.Drawing2D.ClassicMisc#2](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Drawing.Drawing2D.ClassicMisc/CS/form1.cs#2)] [!code-vb[System.Drawing.Drawing2D.ClassicMisc#2](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Winforms/System.Drawing.Drawing2D.ClassicMisc/VB/form1.vb#2)]

Docs.summary: Gets or sets whether the arrow cap is filled.
Docs.value: This property is if the arrow cap is filled; otherwise, .

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the height of the arrow cap.
Docs.value: The height of the arrow cap.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The height of the arrow cap is scaled by the width of the <xref:System.Drawing.Pen> object used to draw the line being capped. For example, if you are drawing a capped line with a pen that has a width of 5 pixels, and the <xref:System.Drawing.Drawing2D.AdjustableArrowCap> object has a height of 3, then the actual arrow cap is drawn 15 pixels high.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the number of units between the outline of the arrow cap and the fill.
Docs.value: The number of units between the outline of the arrow cap and the fill of the arrow cap.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the width of the arrow cap.
Docs.value: The width, in units, of the arrow cap.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The width of the arrow cap is scaled by the width of the <xref:System.Drawing.Pen> object used to draw the line being capped. For example, if you are drawing a capped line with a pen that has a width of 5 pixels, and the <xref:System.Drawing.Drawing2D.AdjustableArrowCap> object has a width of 3, then the actual arrow cap is drawn 15 pixels wide.
